title: Work done moving electron between two points

content.question: What is the work done by the electric force in moving an electron from point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="3.2, times 10 to the negative 19 power, joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mtext></mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

It cannot be determined because it depends on the path taken from <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
